Browse the source code of netbsd/external/lgpl3/mpfr/dist/src/nrandom.c

1/* mpfr_nrandom (rop, state, rnd_mode) -- Generate a normal deviate with mean 0
2 and variance 1 and round it to the precision of rop according to the given
3 rounding mode.
4
5Copyright 2013-2018 Free Software Foundation, Inc.
6Contributed by Charles Karney <charles@karney.com>, SRI International.
7
8This file is part of the GNU MPFR Library.
9
10The GNU MPFR Library is free software; you can redistribute it and/or modify
11it under the terms of the GNU Lesser General Public License as published by
12the Free Software Foundation; either version 3 of the License, or (at your
13option) any later version.
14
15The GNU MPFR Library is distributed in the hope that it will be useful, but
16WITHOUT ANY WARRANTY; without even the implied warranty of MERCHANTABILITY
17or FITNESS FOR A PARTICULAR PURPOSE. See the GNU Lesser General Public
18License for more details.
19
20You should have received a copy of the GNU Lesser General Public License
21along with the GNU MPFR Library; see the file COPYING.LESSER. If not, see
22http://www.gnu.org/licenses/ or write to the Free Software Foundation, Inc.,
2351 Franklin St, Fifth Floor, Boston, MA 02110-1301, USA. */
24
25/*
26 * Sampling from the normal distribution with zero mean and unit variance.
27 * This uses Algorithm N given in:
28 * Charles F. F. Karney,
29 * "Sampling exactly from the normal distribution",
30 * ACM Trans. Math. Software 42(1), 3:1-14 (Jan. 2016).
31 * https://dx.doi.org/10.1145/2710016
32 * http://arxiv.org/abs/1303.6257
33 *
34 * The implementation here closely follows the C++ one given in the paper
35 * above. However, here, C is simplified by using gmp_urandomm_ui; the initial
36 * rejection step in H just tests the leading bit of p; and the assignment of
37 * the sign to the deviate using gmp_urandomb_ui. Finally, the C++
38 * implementation benefits from caching temporary random deviates across calls.
39 * This isn't possible in C without additional machinery which would complicate
40 * the interface.
41 *
42 * There are a few "weasel words" regarding the accuracy of this
43 * implementation. The algorithm produces exactly rounded normal deviates
44 * provided that gmp's random number engine delivers truly random bits. If it
45 * did, the algorithm would be perfect; however, this implementation would have
46 * problems, e.g., in that the integer part of the normal deviate is
47 * represented by an unsigned long, whereas in reality the integer part in
48 * unbounded. In this implementation, asserts catch overflow in the integer
49 * part and similar (very, very) unlikely events. In reality, of course, gmp's
50 * random number engine has a finite internal state (19937 bits in the case of
51 * the MT19937 method). This means that these unlikely events in fact won't
52 * occur. If the asserts are triggered, then this is an indication that the
53 * random number engine is defective. (Even if a hardware random number
54 * generator were used, the most likely explanation for the triggering of the
55 * asserts would be that the hardware generator was broken.)
56 */
57
58#include "random_deviate.h"
59
60/* Algorithm H: true with probability exp(-1/2). */
61static int
62H (gmp_randstate_t r, mpfr_random_deviate_t p, mpfr_random_deviate_t q)
63{
64 /* p and q are temporaries */
65 mpfr_random_deviate_reset (p);
66 if (mpfr_random_deviate_tstbit (p, 1, r))
67 return 1;
68 for (;;)
69 {
70 mpfr_random_deviate_reset (q);
71 if (!mpfr_random_deviate_less (q, p, r))
72 return 0;
73 mpfr_random_deviate_reset (p);
74 if (!mpfr_random_deviate_less (p, q, r))
75 return 1;
76 }
77}
78
79/* Step N1: return n >= 0 with prob. exp(-n/2) * (1 - exp(-1/2)). */
80static unsigned long
81G (gmp_randstate_t r, mpfr_random_deviate_t p, mpfr_random_deviate_t q)
82{
83 /* p and q are temporaries */
84 unsigned long n = 0;
85
86 while (H (r, p, q))
87 {
88 ++n;
89 /* Catch n wrapping around to 0; for a 32-bit unsigned long, the
90 * probability of this is exp(-2^30)). */
91 MPFR_ASSERTN (n != 0UL);
92 }
93 return n;
94}
95
96/* Step N2: true with probability exp(-m*n/2). */
97static int
98P (unsigned long m, unsigned long n, gmp_randstate_t r,
99 mpfr_random_deviate_t p, mpfr_random_deviate_t q)
100{
101 /* p and q are temporaries. m*n is passed as two separate parameters to deal
102 * with the case where m*n overflows an unsigned long. This may be called
103 * with m = 0 and n = (unsigned long)(-1) and, because m in handled in to the
104 * outer loop, this routine will correctly return 1. */
105 while (m--)
106 {
107 unsigned long k = n;
108 while (k--)
109 {
110 if (!H (r, p, q))
111 return 0;
112 }
113 }
114 return 1;
115}
116
117/* Algorithm C: return (-1, 0, 1) with prob (1/m, 1/m, 1-2/m). */
118static int
119C (unsigned long m, gmp_randstate_t r)
120{
121 unsigned long n = gmp_urandomm_ui (r, m);
122 return n == 0 ? -1 : (n == 1 ? 0 : 1);
123}
124
125/* Algorithm B: true with prob exp(-x * (2*k + x) / (2*k + 2)). */
126static int
127B (unsigned long k, mpfr_random_deviate_t x, gmp_randstate_t r,
128 mpfr_random_deviate_t p, mpfr_random_deviate_t q)
129{
130 /* p and q are temporaries */
131
132 unsigned long m = 2 * k + 2;
133 /* n tracks the parity of the loop; s == 1 on first trip through loop. */
134 unsigned n = 0, s = 1;
135 int f;
136
137 /* Check if 2 * k + 2 would overflow; for a 32-bit unsigned long, the
138 * probability of this is exp(-2^61)). */
139 MPFR_ASSERTN (k < ((unsigned long)(-1) >> 1));
140
141 for (;; ++n, s = 0) /* overflow of n is innocuous */
142 {
143 if ( ((f = k ? 0 : C (m, r)) < 0) ||
144 (mpfr_random_deviate_reset (q),
145 !mpfr_random_deviate_less (q, s ? x : p, r)) ||
146 ((f = k ? C (m, r) : f) < 0) ||
147 (f == 0 &&
148 (mpfr_random_deviate_reset (p),
149 !mpfr_random_deviate_less (p, x, r))) )
150 break;
151 mpfr_random_deviate_swap (p, q); /* an efficient way of doing p = q */
152 }
153 return (n & 1U) == 0;
154}
155
156/* return a normal random deviate with mean 0 and variance 1 as a MPFR */
157int
158mpfr_nrandom (mpfr_t z, gmp_randstate_t r, mpfr_rnd_t rnd)
159{
160 mpfr_random_deviate_t x, p, q;
161 int inex;
162 unsigned long k, j;
163
164 mpfr_random_deviate_init (x);
165 mpfr_random_deviate_init (p);
166 mpfr_random_deviate_init (q);
167 for (;;)
168 {
169 k = G (r, p, q); /* step 1 */
170 if (!P (k, k - 1, r, p, q))
171 continue; /* step 2 */
172 mpfr_random_deviate_reset (x); /* step 3 */
173 for (j = 0; j <= k && B (k, x, r, p, q); ++j); /* step 4 */
174 if (j > k)
175 break;
176 }
177 mpfr_random_deviate_clear (q);
178 mpfr_random_deviate_clear (p);
179 /* steps 5, 6, 7 */
180 inex = mpfr_random_deviate_value (gmp_urandomb_ui (r, 1), k, x, z, r, rnd);
181 mpfr_random_deviate_clear (x);
182 return inex;
183}
